snippet: An artwork that lets visitors walk through a downpour without getting wet, a hit in New York in 2013, has taken on new meaning with its arrival at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.
abstract: Opening of exhibit Rain Room, installation which allows visitors to walk through downpour without getting wet, at Los Angeles County Museum of Art hits poignant note in region desiccated by worst drought in California's history; supporters address questions about exhibition's appropriateness by stressing its use of relatively small amount of recycled water, and its ability to provoke thoughtful dialogue.
lead_paragraph: An artwork that lets visitors walk through a downpour without getting wet, a hit in New York in 2013, has taken on new meaning with its arrival at the Los Angeles County Museum of Art.

headline.main: Drought Adds Wrinkle to ‘Rain Room’ Exhibit in California
headline.print_headline: Rain Kept Out of Reach? Artwork Meets Reality

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Los Angeles County Museum of Art
